Synthea
Audio for Unscripted Theater
Synthea is a customizable soundboard program designed for dynamic playback of sound effects, ambience, and music in unscripted environments. It was written for use in improvised theater, but is ideal for any live performance where pre-programmed cues won't cut it.

What Synthea Does

Synthea provides a tabbed software soundboard for realtime playback of sound effects, ambience, and music. It's easy-to-use interface makes it a quick solution to any live production, while it's powerful features provide deep customization and precision for advanced users.

Some key features include:

Convenient Queuing
Line up sound cues in advance to play back when you need them— on demand, sequentially, or all at once.

Automatic Crossfading
When a sound cue is paused or stopped, Synthea automatically fades the sound out so you don't have to worry about it. With realtime board toggles and optional cue-specific settings, you choose whether new cues fade in or start at full volume.

Smart Subgroups
Tag sound cues to different "subgroups" to control overlays. Cues in the same subgroup replace one another, while cues in different subgroups play concurrently.

Individual Playback Controls
Each sound cue, whether playing or in the queue, has individual controls for play, pause, seek, and loop. Complete control is at your fingertips.

Hotkeys
Program keyboard shortcuts to frequently-used sound cues so you can play them instantly no matter where you are on the board.

File Randomization
Attach multiple sound files to a single cue for randomized, non-repeating playback. Each time you hit the cue, a different file will play—for a more immersive experience.

Scalable, Tab-Based Interface
Handle dozens or even hundreds of sound cues in a project with Synthea's easy board layout.

Why Synthea Exists

In unscripted theater, a sound board operator needs to access effects and music in ways that scripted theater software simply can't handle.

As a tech improviser, I once needed the ability to engage in realtime, unscripted conversation between performers onstage and an "artificial intelligence" controlled in the booth. The AI's dialogue would need to be synthesized from pre-recorded sentence fragments, which would require software to assemble the cues on-the-fly and play them back seamlessly in real-time.

Unable to find any soundboard software capable of this work, I wrote Synthea to do just that. I immediately saw the value this software could provide beyond synthesizing dialogue, and since then Synthea has expanded to provide customized music and sound effects boards for numerous other unscripted plays and improv performances around the world.

It is still in its infancy, but for those willing to give it a shot, I hope Synthea proves to be a useful tool.
